properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 1:19PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...None.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches around Susanville, with 2
to 4 inches for Portola and higher terrain west of Susanville.
Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch,
heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches
around Susanville, with 6 to 14 inches near Portola and in the
higher terrain west of Susanville. Winds could gust as high as
50 mph.

* WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Monday to 4
AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday
evening through Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult during these next
storms. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and
car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry
tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm
arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended
period of time.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
